content.question: Which of the following claims is best supported by the experimental results?

choices.label: Light is required for the electron transport chain to transfer electrons.
Water, not carbon dioxide, is the source of electrons used in the light-dependent reaction of photosynthesis.
Carbon dioxide is the source of carbon used by green plants to build carbohydrates.

<math alttext="D C P I P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DCPIP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> provides a significant source of electrons to the electron transport chain of the light reaction in the absence of light.

content.answer: Light is required for the electron transport chain to transfer electrons.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
